result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
3:25 PM Defendant Nicole M Gulley appeared by video.  Attorney Eryn M Menden in court for Nicole M Gulley.  Prosecuting attorney Peter Michael Tempelis in court for the State of Wisconsin. Victim rights have been complied with by the Waukesha County District Attorneys Office. 
All parties have received and reviewed the report filed by the Doctor. 
State request the court rely on the doctors report.
Atty Menden states her client is competent. 
Court conducts a colloquy with defendant.
Defendant states she is competent.
Court finds the defendant competent.
Atty Menden requests an offer in this matter. 
Atty Menden waives time limits and requests at the next hearing to conduct a waiver of the preliminary hearing. 
Court sets hearing.
Waiver of Prelim scheduled for January 5, 2023 at 02:30 pm.
Waiver of Prelim on January 5, 2023 at 02:30 pm.

10:07 AM District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Abigail Kincheloe.  Defendant Nicole M Gulley in court.  Attorney Eryn M Menden in court for Nicole M Gulley. 
Victim rights have been complied with by the Waukesha County District Attorneys Office. 
The report has not been filed yet by the doctor in case 22CF1490.   
Atty Menden does request the competency order be vacated and states reasons on the record in case 22CF1490.
Court will continue the order and have the doctor complete the report. 
Court will set a hearing for review of doctors report in case 22CF1490 and defendant is allowed to appear by zoom.
Hearing scheduled for October 31, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
Hearing on October 31, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

dated 8/26/22 from Atty Menden re: zoom request
**9/29/22 approved per court**
Hearing on September 7, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Case called at 10:03 AM 
District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Nicole M Gulley in court, in custody at Washington County Jail by zoom, with attorney Eryn M Menden.   
All parties have agreed that some may have the hearing conducted remotely. This hearing has met the statutory standards for video conferencing.
Attorney Menden requests another hearing date.  Cout grants.  Hearing scheduled for September 7, 2022 at 09:00 am.
dated 06-30-2022, filed by Defendant re: appearing via zoom from Washington County Jail.
Hearing on July 11, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Defendant waives her right to a Preliminary Hearing.

10:16 AM Defendant Nicole M Gulley in court, in custody, with attorney Eryn M Menden.   Peter Michael Tempelis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The Court finds that the Defendants waiver to a preliminary hearing is knowing and voluntary.  Waive reading of Information.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Bail remains as fixed.  Defendant to be returned to Washington County Jail forthwith.  Attorney Menden states the defendant will be released from custody at the end of June and requests a date in July.  Court sets matter for a further proceedings date and no video appearance will need to be set up due to the defendant being released from custody.  If this changes, Attorney Menden will inform the trial court that a video appearance needs to be set up.  Hearing scheduled for July 11, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on May 6, 2022 at 10:15 am.

08:28 AM Defendant Nicole M Gulley appeared by Zoom from Washington County Jail, in custody, with Attorney Andrew Herbers attorney Eryn M Menden.   Andrew Nesheim appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  All parties have agreed that some may have the hearing conducted remotely. This hearing has met the statutory standards for video conferencing.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Preliminary Hearing requested.  Preliminary time limits waived.  Clerk of Courts Office to prepare Order to Produce from Washington County Jail.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 6, 2022 at 10:15 am.
